text: Ashan with its pasture lands, Jetta with its pasture lands, and Beth-shemesh with its pasture lands.
He gave up his life to save his people and win an everlasting name for himself.
All that is done for these gods is a fraud; how then can it be thought or claimed that they are gods?
Those who ate [of the loaves] were five thousand men. The Walking on the Water.
For every tree is known by its own fruit. For people do not pick figs from thornbushes, nor do they gather grapes from brambles.
No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draw him, and I will raise him on the last day.
